column2: NORTH CAROLINA DMV TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign means:
column10: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 3. This sign means:
4. This road sign means:
5. This sign means drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column8: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
7. This road sign means:
column6: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column8: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 9. The picture shows:
10. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.
column10: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
12. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column6: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 13. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column10: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 14. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
15. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column10: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.

column2: 16. ABS is the acronym for:

17. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
18. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
19. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column6: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column8: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column10: Drivers are not required to stop.

column2: 20. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.

column2: 21. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car approaching from the right.
column6: The car approaching from the left.
column8: The car that is traveling faster.
column10: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.

column2: 22. While driving, it is important to slow down:
23. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 24. Arrows on the roadway:
column8: show which lanes you must use.
column10: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 25. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 26. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column8: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 27. Braking distance is affected by:
column4: the condition of your brakes and tires.
column8: the speed your vehicle is traveling.

column2: 28. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 29. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: slow down at the traffic signal.
column10: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.

column2: 30. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column6: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column10: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 31. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column4: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 32. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
33. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
34. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your attention away from driving
column6: take your hands off the wheel
column8: take your eyes off the road

column2: 35. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column6: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column8: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.

column2: 36. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 37. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
